title: How to Cook Spaghetti Bolognaise

steps.headline: Fry the onion, celery and carrot on low heat in a little bit of oil.
Add the garlic when they become slightly translucent.
Wait a few minutes, and add the mince.
steps.description: Turn the heat up to a medium temperature.

steps.headline: Keep stirring the mince to avoid sticking and burning.
Turn the heat down to a low temperature when the mince is thoroughly cooked (brown but not burnt).
Add the Oxo cube and stir in.
Add the tin of chopped tomatoes and stir.
Add a small amount of herbs, usually around 1 teaspoon.
Pour in a good glug of wine, no more than half a small glass and stir until the wine has mixed in.
Add tomato puree to thicken.
steps.description: Use anywhere between half a tube and a whole one.

steps.headline: Leave on a low heat to simmer and improve the flavor, preferably for 3-4 hours, though Ok to eat after one hour.

text: Fry the onion, celery and carrot on low heat in a little bit of oil.  Add the garlic when they become slightly translucent.  Wait a few minutes, and add the mince. Turn the heat up to a medium temperature. Keep stirring the mince to avoid sticking and burning.  Turn the heat down to a low temperature when the mince is thoroughly cooked (brown but not burnt).  Add the Oxo cube and stir in.  Add the tin of chopped tomatoes and stir.  Add a small amount of herbs, usually around 1 teaspoon.  Pour in a good glug of wine, no more than half a small glass and stir until the wine has mixed in.  Add tomato puree to thicken. Use anywhere between half a tube and a whole one. Leave on a low heat to simmer and improve the flavor, preferably for 3-4 hours, though Ok to eat after one hour.  Finished.
